_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Five qualities of a resident mendicant t: Restrained in the code of conduct
Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken
Very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned
The teachings they are very learned in [: These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end
Describing a spiritual practice that’s totally full and pure
They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reciting them, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically
Abilities of a resident mendicant [an5.2: Able to inspire those who approach them with a Dhamma talk
